reviews.review_msg: Dr. Curzon's Energy and the Environment course was a major eye opener.  This is a class that needs to be taught well and it was by Curzon.

He is a good person with a good sense of humor. He smiles at his students and available for help. On the other hand, his exams are very tough, and the lectures notes are messy. He is getting too old and I think that he should retire.

I don't reccommend anybody to take his class. It is impossible to understand his hand writing. He mixes ideas and concepts together when he's explaining and therefore it is hard to know what is what. His assignments are so long and hard. His exams are deadly with low class averages, every time he teaches physics 101.
The lectures were incomprehesible and disorganized but he is amazing at explaining concepts one-on-one. He's always willing to give you help if you ask for it.
helpful, but notes are not very useful
WTF was up with the final.  It way above in difficulty compared to the midterms.  Really unfair because I'm sure noone expected that :(.
Midterms were fair but the final exam was way too hard.  And his lecture notes suck.

This professor is very unorganized, he makes numerous mistakes in class in the lecture notes.  The notes are useless anyways as they make no sense when you go back and read them.  His midterms were pretty tough but the final exam was ridicously hard.  He is way too old and should retire.

Has really terrible lecture notes.  I stopped copying his notes after the 2nd week and studied myself from the textbook.  Midterms are fairly easy if you did your homework as it is based heavyily on the assignments.

Wonderful Teacher!. If you take Prof. Curzon's class make sure to write asides indicating important points. He is pretty straight forward and he follows the textbook, but does not reiterate the textbook. He likes to use variables in his examples, so that it can be applied to infinite number of problem sets.

The class was unorganized. He should have had prepared overheads. there were mistakes in several lectures, only to have him correct them later. He sent emails, often several times a day, sometimes to correct mistakes from the correction email. fill in blanks notes would save time give more time for examples of the difficulty level of the prob sets.

If YOU make an effort to speak to him about the troubles you are having with any questions.. he WILL go out of his way to help you as much as he can or untill you are satisfied. I like this guy for all the effort he puts in. =)

Terrible, when u know u have Curzon as a prof, i totally advise you to DROP the CLASS. I'm still choked that i paid for this class... he could be teaching Japanese for all i know - it's that unclear. He never defines any symbols and all the notes are undefined diagrams.

not a very good prof at all. makes assignments so hard and wants you to do everything in ink.  Class notes are NOT useful. have to read the textbook because his notes are not clear ><" makes me HATE physics even MORE!
Can't read his writing.
Funny lectures, but not helpful at all and there's no point to go. Homeworks/midterms/finals are all hard and brutel and time-consuming and he wants you to do everything in INK =(

Course is actually quite easy if you still remember your Phy 11/12. There are no real difficulties except some really weird/unclear pbms in the hwk/test (So many bio related pbms on final). Notes can be messy, but the txt is not hard to read. He also tries too hard to entertain the class w/ his "artistic skills". Maybe he'll be great in art class.
No Comments
No Comments
His notes suck.
Worst teacher I have ever had. He made every concept seem 100x harder than it really was. Do everything you can to avoid him.

Complete inability to teach. He may know physics but he can't communicate it at all. Tests are far too long with absolutely bizare, rediculus questions. If you want your GPA to plumit take him. But he is nice a person, odd personality, but still a terrible teacher.

He is my worst prof ever! Very unclear lectures! Hard long exams!! Weird long hard assignments!! I think he concerns more on jokes than lecture materials!!! Very silly NOT funny jokes!!!!!! He will just lower your grades! NEVER take his class! You will learn nothing from him!

He even said clearly the first day: e-mail, won't answer. Hey, why are we paying him? Also, he makes you hand in assignment at 9:20 am. Okay, the bus gets to school at 9:20. He doesn't give even a 5 minute buffer. Exams are very long, even you write continuously you might not even finish them (that's what happened to me). Have fun with this prof.
No Comments

He is  very unclear and his explaination is rather hard to understand.  His assignments are soooooo hard and his notes are very hard to read. Very strict on time. He WILL NOT accept homework you hand in after 9:20. Test is better than all of the questions that he gave but still hard.
Very Tough and weird!!!!!!

lecture notes and homework are irrelevant to test. even if the lecture notes where relevant they are impossible to read and the notation he uses is very confusing. class would be alot better if the homwork wasn't some evil little scheme of his.

As much as I hate physics, I don't like him. Weird sense of humour. Bad handwriting (sometimes I can't read what he wrote) and rather challenging assignments. But if you study assignments for midterms, you should be fine. Although I messed up on mine...:(

Interesting sense of humor. Brings all sorts of props and poems in lecs. I have him w/ Emberly, but Curzon definitly have more control over class. I see that he cares about students, but his notes and asns are rather unclear at times. At least he sends email but too often! Very strict about handin and attendence, but tests are easy though q's funny
He's the toughest pro. i 've ever met. Not easy to pass his class.
He is tough. You won't get a B easily.

He's a nice guy but I don't think his teaching style is the best for conveying concepts in physics. Way too much time spent on listing off derivations rather then making an effort to explain concepts. Visit MIT Open Courseware website for an excelent resource for this class ... MIT education for free!!

he is rude to student, and doesn't accept someone's assignment even it is only one minute late.  always repeat himself on how on time he is for class and criticize student for being a litle late...but the worst thing after all is the long exams
A great prof. Gave good notes and was always willing to help. Tough but fair exams. Super nice. All around great prof.
One of the nicest people EVER.  Is actually concerned about you LEARNING the material and not just memorizing formulae.  Fair exams.
has bad writing, but he's forgivable.  he made an effort to write clearer, and it's hard for his age.  very helpful and he gave us fair exams.
Great guy, difficult subject though.
Hard teacher!  I am a practicing engineer and I remember his classes to be the hardest of my whole degree (I was an A- student but really struggled in his class)

I think as a person the guy is golden, very nice, firm believer in being a decent person. But as a prof, I found him patronizing, and quite rude. Writes a very long exam. The material wasn't hard but with no calc. etc... no time to finish exams.
Fair exams. Goes through assignments before they're due. Very helpful. Great prof. Very caring. Too bad he's retired.
his tests are so so hard...-_- ... he always act funny... his note is bad, cant read his writing...
this guys sucks. You can't read ANYTHING and his exams are so hard. Phys class and no calculations???? His exams are messed!
bad notes, bad writing, but funny at most times, good guy but midterms are hard.
Like Simon in American Idol says, this guy's  writing is dreadful!!!
I just think his final was hard. not the midterms
Good sense of humour; his poems are hilarious. Tests are absolute killer. Make sure you take very good notes.
Wonderful person!  Teaches VERY quickly on transparencies. Quite strict. Killer exams.
